newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia Yield Spreads-Widen against the bloc.
newsitem.headline: Australia Yield Spreads-Widen against the bloc.

text.p: Australian bond yield spreads widened against the dollar bloc after speculative futures trades were unwound after the Reserve Bank left monetary policy unchanged after Tuesday's board meeting.
The U.S. market faces a further A$12 billion of supply through a 10-year note sale on Wednesday, the last part of the quarterly refunding auctions.
The Canadian market outperformed the U.S. again, even though it also faces supply with the sale of C$2.4 billion of 10-year bonds later on Wednesday.

The local market also underperformed against a weakened New Zealand market, which was underpressure from a fall in the N.Z. TWI and comments by RBNZ governor Don Brash, which failed to reassure the market that its recent easing in monetary conditions were appropriate.
